intro: Oryza sativa var. ferruginea, commonly known as the red rice, is a variety of rice characterized by its reddish pericarp. This variety is native to Southeast Asia and is often used as a specialty grain. The plant typically grows to a height of about 100–120 cm and has a short, compact inflorescence. Its grains are smaller and more aromatic compared to common rice varieties. The botanical features of this rice make it distinct in both appearance and culinary use.
